required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 4 Week Study to Investigate the Safety and Tolerability of AZD5069 in Patients With Moderate to Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
clinical_study.official_title: A 4 Week, Double Blind, Placebo Controlled, Randomised, Parallel Group, Multicentre, Phase IIa Study to Investigate the Safety and Tolerability of AZD5069 as Oral Capsules in Patients With Moderate to Severe Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is the evaluate the safety and tolerability of AZD5069 in patients with Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease

primary_outcome.measure: Patients Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Events(s)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of treatment (Day 0) up to 28 days (End of Treatment)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse event (AE) data, both serious and non-serious. An AE is the development of an undesirable medical condition (eg, nausea, chest pain, tachycardia, laboratory findings) or the deterioration of a pre-existing medical condition following or during exposure to a pharmaceutical product, whether or not considered causally related to the product.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Physical Examination Findings
primary_outcome.time_frame: Last Observation on Treatment (up to Day 28)
primary_outcome.description: Physical examination includes assessment of general appearance, skin, head and neck (including ears, eyes, nose and throat), lymph nodes, musculo-skeletal (including spine and extremities), cardiovascular, lungs and abdomen. The findings were deemed to be normal/abnormal based on the clinical judgment of the investigator.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Abnormal Electrocardiogram (ECG)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (last non-missing assessment prior to first dose of study medication) and End of Treatment (Day 28)
primary_outcome.description: ECGs were recorded in the supine position after the patient has rested for 10 minutes. Heart rate, QRS duration, PR, RR and QT intervals were recorded. Overall evaluation of the ECG is classified as normal, abnormal or borderline. Only participants with ECG at baseline classified as normal are reported (ie, only changes from normal to abnormal).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment for Leucocytes Count in Blood (Safety Blood Sample)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (last non-missing assessment prior to first dose of study medication) and End of Treatment (Day 28)
primary_outcome.description: The change in circulating leucocyte counts (including neutrophils) is calculated as the End of Treatment value minus the Baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment for Body Temperature
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (last non-missing assessment prior to first dose of study medication) and End of Treatment (Day 28)
primary_outcome.description: The change in body temperature (oral) is calculated as the End of Treatment value minus the Baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment for Systolic Blood Preassure (Vital Signs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (last non-missing assessment prior to first dose of study medication) and End of Treatment (Day 28)
primary_outcome.description: The change in systolic blood pressure (Vital Sign) is calculated as the End of Treatment value minus the Baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment for Diastolic Blood Pressure (Vital Signs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (last non-missing assessment prior to first dose of study medication) and End of Treatment (Day 28)
primary_outcome.description: The change in diastolic blood pressure (Vital Sign) is calculated as the End of Treatment value minus the Baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment for Pulse Rate (Vital Signs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (last non-missing assessment prior to first dose of study medication) and End of Treatment (Day 28)
primary_outcome.description: The change in pulse rate (Vital Sign) is calculated as the End of Treatment value minus the Baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment for FEV1 Pre-bronchodilator (Lung Function Test)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (last non-missing assessment prior to first dose of study medication) and End of Treatment (Day 28)
primary_outcome.description: The change in FEV1 Pre-bronchodilator is calculated as the End of Treatment value minus the Baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment for FEV1 Post-bronchodilator (Lung Function Test)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (last non-missing assessment prior to first dose of study medication) and End of Treatment (Day 28)
primary_outcome.description: The change in FEV1 Post-bronchodilator is calculated as the End of Treatment value minus the Baseline value.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Developed High Transaminase Values (Clinical Chemistry)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Follow-up Visit (3 to 18 days after End of Treatment [Day 28])
primary_outcome.description: High Transaminase Values are defined as a measurment of ALT (alanine aminotransferase) or AST (aspartate aminotransferase) greater than or equal to 3 times the upper limit of normal (ALT ULN = 36 IU/L, AST ULN = 33 IU/L).

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to End of Treatment for Total Protein (Urinalysis)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (last non-missing assessment prior to first dose of study medication) and End of Treatment (Day 28)
primary_outcome.description: The change in total protein in urine is calculated as the End of Treatment value minus the Baseline value.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Concentration of AZD5069 After 1 Hour of Dosing
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of Treatment (Day 28), 1 hour after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: At this visit, approximately 1 hour after dosing (at the clinic), a blood sample was collected for determination of drug concentration in plasma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve of AZD5069
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of Treatment (Day 28); pre-dose, 1, 2, 3, and 5 hours after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: The area under the plasma concentration curve is estimated from time 0 (dosing) to 24 hours after dosing.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of Treatment (Day 28); pre-dose, 1, 2, 3, and 5 hours after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: The maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) is the highest level of drug in plasma.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration for AZD5069
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of Treatment (Day 28); pre-dose, 1, 2, 3, and 5 hours after dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Time (in relation to dosing) at which the maximum plasma concentration is observed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Reduction of Circulating Neutrophils in Blood, From Baseline
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline (last non-missing assessment prior to first dose of study medication), weeks 1, 2 and 3, and End of Treatment (Day 28)
secondary_outcome.description: The change in circulating neutrophils in blood is calculated as the visit value minus the Baseline value. Only participants with reduction are considered.

clinical_study.condition: Scientific Terminology Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD)
Laymen Terminology Chronic Bronchitis and Emphysema

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of COPD with symptoms for more than one year before screening
- Body mass index of 18-30 kg/m2 and weight of 50-100kg
- Current or ex-smokers with a smoking history of at least 10 pack years (1 pack year = tobacco consumption corresponding to 20 cigarettes smoked per day for one year) at screening
- FEV1 of 30% or above and less than 80% of the predicted normal value post-bronchodilator at screening
- FEV1/FVC less than 70% post-bronchodilator at screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any clinically significant disease or disorder
- Exacerbation of COPD which was not resolved within 30 days of first dosing
- Patients who have received live or live-attenuated vaccine in the 2 weeks prior to first dosing
- Asthma and any current respiratory tract disorder other than COPD which is considered to be clinically significant
- Disease history suggesting reduced or abnormal immune function other than that related to COPD

reference.citation: Kirsten AM, Förster K, Radeczky E, Linnhoff A, Balint B, Watz H, Wray H, Salkeld L, Cullberg M, Larsson B. The safety and tolerability of oral AZD5069, a selective CXCR2 antagonist, in patients with moderate-to-severe COPD. Pulm Pharmacol Ther. 2015 Apr;31:36-41. doi: 10.1016/j.pupt.2015.02.001. Epub 2015 Feb 11.

clinical_study.keyword: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease, Neutrophil, Respiratory Disease

participant_flow.recruitment_details: First patient enrolled: 22 November 2010. Last patient completed: 22 March 2011. Fifteen centres across 4 countries participated in this study: Bulgaria (4), Germany (4), Hungary (4) and Ukraine (3)
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 22 patients enrolled were not randomized due to eligibility not fulfilled (17 patients) and voluntary discontinuation (5 patients)

group.title: AZD5069 50 mg
group.description: 1 x 50 mg AZD5069 capsule and 3 x placebo capsules, bid

group.title: AZD5069 50 mg
group.description: 1 x 50 mg AZD5069 capsule and 3 x placebo capsules, bid

measure.title: Age
Gender
Body Mass Index
Weight
% Predicted FEV1 at screening
FEV1/FVC at screening
Nicotine pack years
measure.description: one pack year= 1 pack (20 cigrettes) per day for 1 year, or equivalent

measure.title: GOLD classification
measure.description: The spirometric classification of severity COPD now includes four stages: Stage I: Mild; Stage II: Moderate; Stage III: Severe; Stage IV: Very Severe.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
